page.title: 19HOUSING AND HOMES
page.content: Most of the houses in Borehamwood were built by the Council round about 30 years ago. Some of them have recently been made available for their occupants to purchase. There are relatively few older properties, and hardly any buildings more than 200 years old. All the flats have been built by the Council since 1970. Though some of the older flats are situated above shops (and without garages) the more recent ones have better facilities and are in separate blocks, of which the highest is Canterbury House with 17 floors. This is, in fact, by far the tallest building in the area. Although there was little house-building in the late 1970s, in the last few years there has been an expansion as land has become available through the closure of factories and film studio sites.
